src/lib/components/ExtendableGraph.react.description:
ExtendableGraph can be used to render any plotly.js-powered data vis.

You can define callbacks based on user interaction with ExtendableGraphs such
as hovering, clicking or selecting

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

responsive.description:
If True, the Plotly.js plot will be fully responsive to window resize
and parent element resize event. This is achieved by overriding
`config.responsive` to True, `figure.layout.autosize` to True and unsetting
`figure.layout.height` and `figure.layout.width`.
If False, the Plotly.js plot not be responsive to window resize and
parent element resize event. This is achieved by overriding `config.responsive`
to False and `figure.layout.autosize` to False.
If 'auto' (default), the Graph will determine if the Plotly.js plot can be made fully
responsive (True) or not (False) based on the values in `config.responsive`,
`figure.layout.autosize`, `figure.layout.height`, `figure.layout.width`.
This is the legacy behavior of the ExtendableGraph component.

Needs to be combined with appropriate dimension / styling through the `style` prop
to fully take effect.

clickData.description: Data from latest click event. Read-only.

clickAnnotationData.description: Data from latest click annotation event. Read-only.

hoverData.description: Data from latest hover event. Read-only.

clear_on_unhover.description:
If True, `clear_on_unhover` will clear the `hoverData` property
when the user "unhovers" from a point.
If False, then the `hoverData` property will be equal to the
data from the last point that was hovered over.

selectedData.description: Data from latest select event. Read-only.

relayoutData.description:
Data from latest relayout event which occurs
when the user zooms or pans on the plot or other
layout-level edits. Has the form `{<attr string>: <value>}`
describing the changes made. Read-only.

extendData.description:
Data that should be appended to existing traces. Has the form
`[updateData, traceIndices, maxPoints]`, where `updateData` is an array
containing data objects to extend, `traceIndices` (optional) is an array
of trace indices that should be extended, and `maxPoints` (optional) is
either an integer defining the maximum number of points allowed or an
object with key:value pairs matching `updateData`
Reference the Plotly.extendTraces API for full usage:
https://plot.ly/javascript/plotlyjs-function-reference/#plotlyextendtraces

restyleData.description:
Data from latest restyle event which occurs
when the user toggles a legend item, changes
parcoords selections, or other trace-level edits.
Has the form `[edits, indices]`, where `edits` is an object
`{<attr string>: <value>}` describing the changes made,
and `indices` is an array of trace indices that were edited.
Read-only.

figure.description:
Plotly `figure` object. See schema:
https://plot.ly/javascript/reference

`config` is set separately by the `config` property

style.description: Generic style overrides on the plot div

animate.description:
Beta: If true, animate between updates using
plotly.js's `animate` function

animation_options.description:
Beta: Object containing animation settings.
Only applies if `animate` is `true`

staticPlot.name: bool
staticPlot.description: No interactivity, for export or image generation

plotlyServerURL.name: string
plotlyServerURL.description: Base URL for a Plotly cloud instance, if `showSendToCloud` is enabled

editable.name: bool
editable.description:
We can edit titles, move annotations, etc - sets all pieces of `edits`
unless a separate `edits` config item overrides individual parts

annotationPosition.name: bool
annotationPosition.description:
The main anchor of the annotation, which is the
text (if no arrow) or the arrow (which drags the whole thing leaving
the arrow length & direction unchanged)

annotationTail.name: bool
annotationTail.description: Just for annotations with arrows, change the length and direction of the arrow

legendText.name: bool
legendText.description: Edit the trace name fields from the legend

autosizable.name: bool
autosizable.description:
DO autosize once regardless of layout.autosize
(use default width or height values otherwise)

responsive.name: bool
responsive.description: Whether to change layout size when the window size changes

queueLength.name: number
queueLength.description: Set the length of the undo/redo queue

fillFrame.name: bool
fillFrame.description: If we DO autosize, do we fill the container or the screen?

frameMargins.name: number
frameMargins.description: If we DO autosize, set the frame margins in percents of plot size

scrollZoom.name: bool
scrollZoom.description: Mousewheel or two-finger scroll zooms the plot

showTips.name: bool
showTips.description: New users see some hints about interactivity

showAxisRangeEntryBoxes.name: bool
showAxisRangeEntryBoxes.description:
Enable direct range entry at the pan/zoom drag points
(drag handles must be enabled above)

showLink.name: bool
showLink.description: Link to open this plot in plotly

sendData.name: bool
sendData.description: If we show a link, does it contain data or just link to a plotly file?

linkText.name: string
linkText.description: Text appearing in the sendData link

displayModeBar.name: enum
displayModeBar.description: Display the mode bar (true, false, or 'hover')

showSendToCloud.name: bool
showSendToCloud.description:
Should we include a modebar button to send this data to a
Plotly Cloud instance, linked by `plotlyServerURL`.
By default this is false.

modeBarButtonsToRemove.name: array

modeBarButtonsToAdd.name: array
modeBarButtonsToAdd.description: Add mode bar button using config objects

modeBarButtons.name: any
modeBarButtons.description:
Fully custom mode bar buttons as nested array,
where the outer arrays represents button groups, and
the inner arrays have buttons config objects or names of default buttons

toImageButtonOptions.name: exact

filename.name: string
filename.description: The name given to the downloaded file

width.name: number
width.description: Width of the downloaded file, in px

height.name: number
height.description: Height of the downloaded file, in px

scale.name: number
scale.description:
Extra resolution to give the file after
rendering it with the given width and height

toImageButtonOptions.description: Modifications to how the toImage modebar button works

displaylogo.name: bool
displaylogo.description: Add the plotly logo on the end of the mode bar

watermark.name: bool
watermark.description: Add the plotly logo even with no modebar

plotGlPixelRatio.name: number
plotGlPixelRatio.description: Increase the pixel ratio for Gl plot images

topojsonURL.name: string
topojsonURL.description: URL to topojson files used in geo charts

mapboxAccessToken.name: any
mapboxAccessToken.description:
Mapbox access token (required to plot mapbox trace types)
If using an Mapbox Atlas server, set this option to '',
so that plotly.js won't attempt to authenticate to the public Mapbox server.

locale.name: string
locale.description:
The locale to use. Locales may be provided with the plot
(`locales` below) or by loading them on the page, see:
https://github.com/plotly/plotly.js/blob/master/dist/README.md#to-include-localization

locales.name: object
locales.description:
Localization definitions, if you choose to provide them with the
plot rather than registering them globally.

config.description:
Plotly.js config options.
See https://plot.ly/javascript/configuration-options/
for more info.

setProps.description: Function that updates the state tree.

is_loading.name: bool
is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not

component_name.name: string
component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer
